    <metadata>

      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>

          <title>
            <string language="fr">Formation de roche sédimentaire à partir de granit</string>
            <string language="en">Sedimentary rock formation from granite</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Sedimentäre Felsenanordnung vom Granit</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Formação de rocha sedimentary do granito</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Formazione rocciosa sedimentaria a partire da 
granito</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ιζηματώδης σχηματισμός βράχου από το γρανίτη</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Formación de roca sedimentaria del granito</string>
          </title>
          <language>x-none</language>
          <description>
            <string language="fr">Cette illustration peut être utilisée pour un  exercice qui montrerait comment un petit grain de granit sur une  montagne devient progressivment une partie d'une certaine nouvelle roche sédimentaire sous la mer.</string>
            <string language="en">This illustration may be used for an exercise that shows how a small grain from some granite on a mountain becomes part of some new sedimentary rock under the sea.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">La terre</string>
            <string language="en">Earth</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">granit</string>
            <string language="en">granite</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">roches plutoniques</string>
            <string language="en">igneous rocks</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">fleuve</string>
            <string language="en">River</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">cycle de roche</string>
            <string language="en">rock cycle</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">recyclage de roche</string>
            <string language="en">rock recycling</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">fond marin</string>
            <string language="en">sea bed</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">roches sédimentaires</string>
            <string language="en">sedimentary rocks</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">effritement</string>
            <string language="en">weathering</string>
          </keyword>
          <structure>
            <source>structureValues</source>
            <value>atomic</value>
          </structure>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Diese Abbildung kann für eine Übung benutzt 
werden, die zeigt, wie ein kleines Korn von etwas Granit auf einem 
Berg Teil irgendeines neuen sedimentären Felsens unter dem Meer wird.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Esta ilustração pode ser usada para um 
exercício que mostre como uma grão pequena de algum granito em uma 
montanha se transforma parte de alguma rocha sedimentary nova sob o 
mar.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Questa illustrazione può essere usata per 
un'esercitazione che mostra come un piccolo grano da un certo granito 
su una montagna si transforma in in parte di una certa nuova roccia 
sedimentaria sotto il mare.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτή η απεικόνιση μπορεί να χρησιμοποιηθεί για μια 
άσκηση που επιδεικνύει πώς ένα μικρό σιτάρι από κάποιο 
γρανίτη σε ένα βουνό γίνεται μέρος κάποιου νέου ιζηματώδους 
βράχου κάτω από τη θάλασσα.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Esta ilustración se puede utilizar para un 
ejercicio que muestre cómo un grano pequeño de un poco de granito en
una montaña se convierte en parte de alguna roca sedimentaria nueva 
bajo el mar.</string>
          </description>
